main event: Two shiny silver cigar-shaped objects were observed moving rapidly and leaving a bright flaming tail behind on September 23, 1963.
interesting points: The objects were estimated to be moving at 30 ft/sec and displayed curving, zigzagging movements,The objects appeared to explode as they disappeared over the horizon,Two smaller cigar-shaped objects were reported to have appeared and disappeared at high speeds, The sighting lasted for about 3 minutes, The observer was located in Farwell, Texas and described the conditions as clear and sunny.
witness description: individual with good reliability, seated behind a large picture window in his gasoline station.
